rows.text_1: Let’s come up with some ideas for reasonable and realistic consequences.
rows.quiz_1_question: Would any of these consequences be helpful for you and your child?
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: If you are late for dinner, your food will be cold.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Great. Discuss this (or another) consequence with your child and family, and try it out together.
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: If you continue splashing water out of the bath, bath time will be over.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Great. Discuss this (or another) consequence with your child and family, and try it out together.
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: If you break your toy, you will have no toy to play with.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Great. Discuss this (or another) consequence with your child and family, and try it out together.
rows.quiz_1_option_4_text: If you can’t play close to home where I can see you, then you will have to come inside.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Great. Discuss this (or another) consequence with your child and family, and try it out together.
rows.quiz_1_option_5_text: If you do not put away your toys before you go to bed, then you cannot play with them tomorrow morning.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_5: Great. Discuss this (or another) consequence with your child and family, and try it out tomorrow.
rows.quiz_1_option_6_text: None of these will work in my home.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_6: That's okay! Try to think of just one consequence that you feel confident you can follow-through with in a calm way. Try starting with something small.
